content.description: Short route with stout moves on thin feet and holds. Good crimps and an under-cling or two on this one.
Short 3 bolt climb on the left side of a west facing arete. No real crux but good climbing.
content.location: 1st bolted climb on the far west side of the crag

climbs.name: En Vogue
climbs.fa: Equipped by: Chase Webb FA: Richard Noel

content.description: This route has three distinct sections. It begins as a quintessential Mount Magazine climb with thought provoking movement up to a rest ledge. Continue up and to the right to a tricky rounded arete in spectacular, sparkly rock. Then you hit a break in the rock and the angle kicks back more than 45 degrees, feeling more like a slice of the Tomb at Rock Creek than the vertical nature of Mag. The steepness leads you to a heartbreaker crux just before the anchors.
content.location: Continue along the approach trail until you reach the obvious white arete, which is the first bolted climb you will reach. Around the corner (climbers right) look for a black water streak leading to a rounded dihedral roof.

content.description: If you take the waterfall walkdown on the far west side of the lodge and then start walking east along the bluff this will be the first set of climbs you come to. The 1st bolted line you will see is a short little climb called Lycrophilia .10a
